website_summaries.verdict: This stylish set of pet bowls looks good but is prone to rust, and its rubber ring can come off too easily.
pros: Attractive steel design and large capacity that most owners like
Lightweight, but flared base discourages tipping
Rubber ring helps prevent pets from sliding bowl around
cons: Rubber ring on bottom can come off when cleaning, but are easy to put back on
Bowl can rust around the “bone” design when used frequently for water

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: I recently left a good review for these bowls however my dog has recently developed a cough and sneeze. He was put on both an antibiotic and steroid to help him - the cough never went away so they assume it was an irritant causing his symptoms. I recently discovered his bowl had this terrible black residue on the bottom that would consistently appear on my paper towel, regardless of how many times I cleaned the dish. This residue appears to be the cause of my dog’s problems. I would recommend NOT buying these dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price.. buying these bowls in store would cost a lot more money. Bowls are a lot bigger then I thought they are
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not the real Stainless steel material.
customer_reviews.text: Not stainless steel. The material is thin. It dosent have that luster of stainless steel of the ones that my dogs previously had. When you look at the bottom of the bowl you cant see your image. With these bowls I can't see my image or when the water needs to be replenished. It looks and feels like a plastic version of stainless steel. I donated them to purple heart.
customer_reviews.author: Cocobuddaflydiva

customer_reviews.title: GPET Dog Bowl 32 Oz Stainless Steel Bowls with Anti-Skid Rubber Base for Food or Water
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. Our 16 year old dog was having difficulty getting the kibble and diced up vegetables etc. out of the round bowls that were at a 90 degree angle on the sides to the bottom. This dish has a nice rounded edge from the bottom up to the sides. It makes it much easier for him to eat and get every little scrap. THANKS for providing this option for our old guy and any new puppy that might come along in the future.
customer_reviews.author: az202

customer_reviews.title: and I was not disappointed. They are packaged nicely with no sticker on ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical of these bowls, but ordered anyway due to the high reviews, and I was not disappointed. They are packaged nicely with no sticker on the bottom which I appreciated, and are good quality. They seem to be made from stainless steel as opposed to aluminum, and the rubber on the bottom, while not amazing, is removeable for cleaning. The only 'downside' to this bowl is I would prefer it plain without the bone, but that is by no means a deal breaker and I would highly recommend this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Real_name_goes_here

customer_reviews.title: Metallic taste in food?
customer_reviews.text: My dog will not eat out of this bowl. Not sure if the metal clashes with the food ....but when I swap to another bowl sheets just fine. Thebowls are cute, lightweight so you will needs ribbermatunder them so they dont slip around. I have had them for 5 months and I do not have any rust even though wewash them everyday. Unfortunately will not be using anymore
customer_reviews.author: LoriPedi

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory although a few minor drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: Decent dog bowls for the price. Rubber rings around bottom are nice in theory but trap water and food and quickly begin to come off when the dog scoots the bowl around, as mine does. Pretty shallow however a wide footprint/diameter so looks large as if for a larger dog but not great for water unless the dog does not drink much or you like to fill their water 10 times a day, but overall satisfied. As I said it is a reasonable price and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not tip
customer_reviews.text: While we are working out the correct medication doses for my dogs seizures she is experiencing some behaviors - including knocking over her food bowl. Thank goodness this bowl does not tip! It is not slip proof, as can push it with her nose, but no more kibble all over the floor (try as she might). She eats out of it no problem. It holds a good amount of food (she's a border collie and it holds the full scoop we use). It's also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: iheartscrapbooking

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it. Dogs love them I'm happy great buy great price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted big enough for water to stay in for the whole day and sturdy enough that they're not going to tip over. The ornamental dog bones on the front great wife loves them. Dogs are totally spoiled now and they'll only drink water out of their metal bowls. No problems with tarnishing staining anything like that easy to clean their sturdy rubber feet on the bottom help them from slipping around on the carpet or the hard floor.
customer_reviews.author: Garbeck

customer_reviews.title: Dishes bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: These dishes are great. I originally got them for my foster pups, who are five pounds and under, because they were advertised for puppies. But when I received them, they were bigger than expected. I should have known. They were advertised as a 32-ounce capacity, which ended up being perfect for my own dogs. So I kept them. When I contacted the company and told them they were bigger than I thought and that I originally was going to use them for puppies I was fostering through my rescue organization, they sent smaller dishes, for free, just for my foster pups. A win-win situation
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the size of these from the comments, but these will be plenty big enough for my aussie even when she is full grown. I haven't run them through the dishwasher yet, but hand washing them is a snap and, even better, my pup can't knock them over like she was with her old bowls. The bones on the front are a nice touch as is the stainless finish.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Different sizes to choose from.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at many different bowls before choosing this set. I have 3 dogs, and there like stair stepped in size. The smallest one had a bowl, but the others needed replacement. The measurements on these bowls were exactly what I needed. When they arrived my wife added food and it was a done deal. You can see they like their bowls now is that weird or what. Maybe it's the little bone on the front of the bowl that sold them. We have a tile floor in the kitchen and the bowls seem to stay in place just fine. I would buy these bowls again. A++++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Doug Olsen

customer_reviews.title: problem solved
customer_reviews.text: i have always fed my dogs from stainless bowls. One of them makes a mess every time he eats, slinging food all over the floor. The other dog has no problems eating from anything. Yesterday, these bowls with rubber rings on the base arrived. The messy dog ate his food without chasing the bowl around the kitchen or throwing food on the floor. Wish I'd found these 12 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Itinerant T

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight  AND bigger than I Imagined!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, they're YUUUUGE! I have a 20 pound WestiePoo and he's used to eating/drinking out of much smaller bowls. Not a problem though, just takes up a bit more space in my hallway than his old dishes. I will say, however, that these bowls are extremely light weight. Other stainless steel bowls I've looked at are heavier; feel more substantial. There's rubber around the bottom for non-slip, so that's good. I will give an update down the road after Scruffy has used them for awhile. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: nitaell72

customer_reviews.title: Slimey cesspool and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting these bowls but the longer I’ve had them...the worse I feel about them. One of them is more flimsy than the other and makes noises when she eats or drinks out of it. And as far as cleaning, water gets trapped underneath the flimsy seal around the bottom. I hadn’t noticed until I smelled mildew and sure enough black slime muck was all underneath the ‘seal’. Nice sturdy, broad base and looks nice, but that’s about it.
customer_reviews.author: McLesF

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean bactiera resistant bowls
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are great. I thought they would be a little heavier but so far my puppy can not flip either of them over. Nether can my ferrets. The bone on the front is attached with metal tabs so it can be removed. The bottom has slip resistant material and it works fine for hard wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Hubcap

customer_reviews.title: a bit flimsy and does not hold 32oz water
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty flimsy, you could easily deform it on accident. The custom stickers are decent and accurately described by the merchant, they look pretty cool. Easy to clean. This does *NOT* hold 32oz of water, only 28oz filled to the rim, and the rubber base is not particularly helpful in preventing the bowl from slipping on hard surfaces, its a very thin liner along the edge not a full base and feels like it might actually be plastic instead of rubber.. but who knows..
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: my 2nd set
customer_reviews.text: My first set, used daily :) is holding up great, but I made the mistake of putting it in the dishwasher, which is hard on the rubber base (coming loose). I will still use the 1st set outdoors and cherish and take better care of my second set. The bowls are heavy, sturdy, do not dent, rust, discolor - perfect. Very happy with this purchase and highly recommend (just think twice about putting them in the dishwasher); although they still look darn good for over 3 years old! thanks for reading my review.
customer_reviews.author: Mary of Arizona

customer_reviews.title: These dog bowls will slip and slide on floors
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product because it stated, the bowls would not slip and slide. This is not true, the bowls were not secure at all on the floor maybe because I have vinyl floors. But, the info on the product did not state a certain type of flooring was recommended. They slip and slide when the dogs are eating or if the cord from the vacuum hits the bowls. I did not return the product because the dogs had eaten out of the bowls. But, every time I see the bowls out of place on the floor I just shake my head and think, what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made!!
customer_reviews.text: ***I purchased these and did NOT get a discount for my review. Got the bowls and they are VERY cheap feeling. I though the bone on the front was molded but nope! It is attached by what seem like manila envelope tabs. It's very bad and the bone slides around on the front. The bowls themselves are very very light and cheaply made. The rubber is a very cheap piece almost like a rubber band. Skip these and spend a few more dollars and get a decent set. I sent mine back the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Love the personalization
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my service pup and had her name put on. Though shes a medium size pup it's a bit small for even a days worth of water bit perfect size for her food. They arrived much faster than stated when I ordered. The name is placed with durable stickers and there has been no issue with them coming off (after 2 months- so far).
customer_reviews.author: TatiyanaTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Best bowls for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got a new puppy last week and wasn't sure what size bowls to get him. These are the perfect transition bowls for Buckley until he gets taller. They are low and wide which is good for a puppy. When he gets taller I will use these for our travel bowls. The bowls are lightweight and I love the the little bone detail. I recommend these for anyone looking for a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Rubber didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The stainless steel portion of these is great quality but the rubber ring around the bottom came off the first day. the whole reason we bought these was for the rubber ring to prevent that horrible scraping sound when your dog scratches the bowl over concrete. Yikes! He eats plastics bowls so we are left looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not skid-proof.
customer_reviews.text: Cute bowls but not skid proof. We have vinyl wood floors and this doesn’t stay out during meal time. Also, the little bone decoration is not part of the molding but attached so may become dirty in the crevices. My puppy has discovered the joys of trying to bite it off. Wouldn’t recommend for puppies or for vinyl wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: MFox

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Love having these bowls for our pup. They are extremely sturdy, well crafted, the metal bone on the front is raised and affixed so looks very nice. Also our pup has not been able to but through the rubber around the bottom so an added plus as he can destroy anything. Definitely worth the cost and can’t be mad that they are SO easy to clean. Just throw in dish washer!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I got these two bowls on the lightening deals and was so glad I did. The look of them are very nice. They are rubberized on the bottom, so they Do not slip on the ground. They look heavy, but are not. However, the Inside of the bowls are smaller in diameter therefore a good measurement For one scoop of dry food. I’m glad I got them. Nice look to them.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: super poor quality
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are not quality at all, they are crazy light weight so it doesn't even matter if they are skid proof because my big dogs can just know them over, they are super small barely hold their 12oz of meat for dinner, the bone attachment looks like junk. I'd return them if it didn't cost me more to send them back than the original cost of the item.
customer_reviews.author: E. Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Get's the Job done
customer_reviews.text: Great dog bowl for my puppy. It's a good size for a puppy, you might want to get a bigger one for a larger bread dog though. Only reason I am getting it 4 stars, is the rubber on the bottom of the bowl does come off semi easily when my puppy plays with. But it goes back on well. So far there is no rips in the rubber yet, but we will see. I recommend this product for smaller bread dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Eden

customer_reviews.title: Well assembled and very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I was worried the bone would simply be glued on and would fail after not much time. It turns out the bone is held on by 4 metal clips that attach it to the inside of the bowl, so it would take a look to make it fall off. The design is very well assembled and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: surrealfrog

customer_reviews.title: Meets Criteria but too shallow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a replacement for similar Amazon Essentials dog bowls. The bowls aren’t as sturdy as I’d like and even slide on a nonslip mat. My other criticism is they’re very shallow and, although it could be my 50 lb dog’s issue, food gets strewn about. They roughly meet the criteria outlined for bowls on amazon but I’ll likely seek another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than I expected but...
customer_reviews.text: Nicer than I expected but these aren't very heavy and still slide. The shallow and cruved design is good as food doesn't get stuck in the corners. These are the large size.
customer_reviews.author: The Little Engine that could

customer_reviews.title: he's grown quite a bit in the last four months so it's perfectly fine for him now
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are big! If you have a small dog please be mindful of that when ordering. My pup was a little under 3lbs when I first brought him home and I realized exactly how big they were when he'd step into the bowl to eat. However, he's grown quite a bit in the last four months so it's perfectly fine for him now.The bowls are beautiful and the grip on the bottom keeps him from pushing it around, unlike the smaller substitute bowls I used during his tiny pup days. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rust???
customer_reviews.text: The bowls are cute, but a little on the flimsy side. I have never had a stainless steel bowl that got rust on it before. The tiny space between the bone and the bowl has rust on it. I thought the bowl was one piece, but the little bone is clipped onto the bowl, and there is a little space where water can go pass.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: These vows are cute. Issue is that very difficult to clean. Have to soak a while just tobuse. The bowl when placing water almost bypasses the bowl and soaks the floor. Quite frustrating. Then of course can never tell if there is water in it unless you touch to see or look super close.
customer_reviews.author: LadyReviews4fun

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl set!
customer_reviews.text: Now my female bully can get out of my Tupperware bowls!!! I also have a Male, and these bowls are a bit small for the amount of ice water I provide for each of them, so they both now have new food bowls! The bone on the bowl helps them know which is for food! Cute idea!
customer_reviews.author: Kristeana Bouyer

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR A PUPPY!! Skids like crazy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not anti skid...I have a puppy that could slide these all over the place even at 8 weeks and she is 7lbs..if she can other bigger dogs will be too. Ended with water everywhere, fast forward 3 week's she's now 13lbs and can pickup and flip the dishes.. water everywhere even if they are barely filled
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Bowls w/ a Unique Design Feature
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality dog bowls. I love the little bone detail on the front; it looks sheek and high end. Additionally, the rubber grips on the bottom truly help the bowls stay in place while my dog eats/drinks (she’s a 90lb lab).
customer_reviews.author: ilona

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace another "stainless steel" set I purchased on here that fell apart within a few weeks, including the rubber around the edge completely breaking off. These are SO much better. They don't feel cheap - they have a good weight to them. The bone is really cute and I did read other reviews that said it isn't attached well and might fall off, but both of mine feel secure and I really could care less if they fall off.
customer_reviews.author: KPTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great set of bowls for your fur baby.
customer_reviews.text: These bowl are perfect. They are light but not too light to where your dog will flip them over. The bottom has a rubber going around the edge so it doesn’t move around the floor freely. Besides all that they are so cute with the 3D Bone on the front. so happy I bought these!!!
customer_reviews.author: madlen

customer_reviews.title: Dog Bowls
customer_reviews.text: I like these dog bowls because they are Stainless steel and are a good size for My Dogs Food. But what I don't like about them it's that any left over Food gets stuck very easily and it's kind of hard to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: R. H

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are big and thin, not heavy at all. The gasket around the bottom easily comes off when I clean the bowls. I wish I had only gotten one of them. It's being used but it's huge. Not the bowls fault, mine. I bought a bowl too big.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for puppy to adult
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my puppy however don't leave a puppy unattended with these bowls lol my pup did her best to tear off the rubber seal on the bottom already. They are the perfect size for a puppy to grow into a adult with, I believe they are 32 oz bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Jc Designs

customer_reviews.title: Great guarantee and service
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are fabulous. We have five Border Collies on three different diets. After I prepare their meals, I simply read the name on the bowl and no one gets the wrong meal! One of the names began peeling off and I returned it for a brand new bowl. Excellent service. I would definitely buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Roseann Lilienthal

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: these barely hold 32oz, the "bone" decoration on the outside traps food and makes them hard to clean, the rubber "gasket" does not stay on, easily slips off totally making the bowl move around too much. very dissatisfied, if I had not used 1 I would return both, probably going to sell at a garage sale
customer_reviews.author: ELLEN RAISBECK

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME STAINLESS STEEL BOWLS!👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are perfect for my two pugs! I like that they have the rubber ring around the bottom, so it helps from sliding bowls. Great price as you receive two bowls! They are super cute because they have a cute bone on the front of each bowl. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: April Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: These are flimsy. The metal is really thin. They feel cheap, as does the plastic ring on the bottom. Both bowls came with a bend/dent in the bottom rim. I'm returning them. They are not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Shallow
customer_reviews.text: These are very cute! I love the bone on the side. Excellent quality. I thought I would use these for my larger dogs but the bowls are shallow. I would recommend these for medium sized dogs. Super cute!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stay Put!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe how quickly these arrived! These are nice doggie dishes, they don’t slide when Ike pushes them with his nose (big plus for me!). They look a lot better than the nasty old plastic dishes we were using. Both dogs were a little intimidated by the stainless steel, but after a couple of tries they caught on that water was actually in the bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Peg Leg

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bowls but Big
customer_reviews.text: Love the rubber bottom to hold them on the floor and not slip. However, we couldn't find if we could wash in teh dishwasher. It's kind of a pain to always have to wash by hand. Nice bowls overall. Big.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Legreid

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles likes her bowl
customer_reviews.text: A little bit lighter than I expected it to be, hence the rating. Has rubber base so it doesn't move, though. Our Boston Terrier mix doesn't care; just make sure there's food in it when the alarm goes off to feed her.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for two bowls.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bowls for a daughter that doesn't have her dog yet. She is looking for a Lab rescue so don't know what age dog she will get. I have unboxed them and they feel good weight wise, and the size seems good. Price was much less that going to the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: We gave our kids this set of dog dishes as a way of telling them they were getting a puppy, so they haven't been used yet. The rubber bottom will be great for helping with sliding, but they are a little thinner than I thought they would be. The bones on the front are a nice little detail. I am sure our future pup will enjoy many meals in these dishes!
customer_reviews.author: CFro

customer_reviews.title: Fair priced/excellent for a full grown dog
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are super nice. I like that they came in a single package and they match. If this is for a full sized dog, it is perfect, but if they're for a small puppy, then you might want to look at other options. Overall, the bowls are nice and so is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have stainless!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bowls, very good quality for the money! Replaced plain stainless dog bowls after 10 years. Definitely a pet owner must-have! Bacteria hates stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Diana DeQuattro

customer_reviews.title: Allergy/RedTear Prevention!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying 4 of these! I put them all over the house so she has water, (I have 3 floors) including the basement movie room. The bottom is rubber so they stay put and my dog LIVES to play in water and drag bowls. This was a perfect fix for dragging! Perfect to help prevent my Maltese red tears and allergies!
customer_reviews.author: Jenocidal

customer_reviews.title: Much too light
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is very lightweight and doesn't stay put. And the letters are painted on and might wash off with time. I thought I was getting two bowls as the ad indicated, but I only received one bowl.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Rusty bowls
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these bowls, cute design and the perfect size for my pup. I've had them for about a month now and although they are described as stainless steel they are rusting. I've decided to return the product for something that wont rust.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luce

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for low price
customer_reviews.text: Looks very cute. I love the gold accent of the bone. Holds enough food for our largest pit bulls meals. I would say he gets around 1.5 cups for measure on how much it comfortably holds. I would like if the piece on the bottom of the bowls had more grip, they move around a little bit, but for the price it doesn’t bother me that much. Still would give 5 stars for the price/quality comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. But I wash my dogs bowls often. The rubber ring comes off easily and cannot be replaced. Other then that held up well. For the price worth it. But you have to plan on replacing before too long if you wash often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has good prices but if you return any item
customer_reviews.text: This review is for AMAZON. I need bigger bowls than these. Amazon has good prices but if you return any item, they charge you half price of the product or more. It’s not worth it to buy anything from them if this is how they treat their customers I have a second set of bowls for my dog and they’re the perfect size for her.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The rubber around the bottom is not very well secured to the bowl. It ended up pulling away in places and I had to remove it. The bowl is not heavy at all. That might be good but my pups just turned it upside down with no effort.
customer_reviews.author: DMinVA

customer_reviews.title: Love these Bowls!
customer_reviews.text: Bowls work great for my dog. ( I mean they're bowls, not like they can malfunction ) They do not grip on hard surfaces so if you're buying them to not slide I would go elsewhere. I didn't mind that they move around so they work for me. Plus they look adorable in my kitchen :)
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina B.

customer_reviews.title: Great size and super cute - gets here FAST!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bowl! It’s a great size for a big dog so the fact i have a little dog is great! It’s seriously is soooo adorable i love it. Oh, and did I mention it literally arrived within 2 days ?!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend for puppies
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend for puppies. Haven't even had a day and my puppy ate the rubber right off. The rubber just pops off, its not anyway attached to the bowl and practically falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Kels

customer_reviews.title: Dog bowls
customer_reviews.text: The dog bowls are attractive and a good size. I thought they could have been a touch bit heavier made, the metal is thin, but you can't have everything. all in all they will work.
customer_reviews.author: Keitha J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not 32 ounces
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are not 32 ounces. They’re about 28 ounces and because of the shape of them you really can’t fit more than 18 ounces without it spilling all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Chernicki

customer_reviews.title: Big and shiny and non-skid!!
customer_reviews.text: Big , shiny and non-skid. The girls love their new bowls, no more chasing dinner around the room. They are also very easy to clean. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Bowl for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I really like the rubber bottom but these were way larger then I thought they'd be! My puppy was pretty terrified of them to be honest. She still uses one for water but we've purchased a plastic less noisey bowl for food. The bone doesn't seem to be on very well, but as long as your dog isn't playing with it, it shouldn't come off. Looks nice, smudges easily from doggy nose kisses. For a cheap dish I'd recommend them especially for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: These look nice...but...
customer_reviews.text: Returned as the rubber rings on the bottoms were damaged and even had they not been damaged on arrival, I can’t imagine they would hold up over any amount of time and use. Cheap. Also, the depth of these bowls is very shallow and would not work with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: CaliTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Dogs haven't complained
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 for my dogs. They arrived on time, in good condition but they seem a little cheap. They're thin, they don't rinse easily, they really need to be sponged after use and they're kinda noisy (tinny sound) but they serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: JACEs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but not for bigger dogs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bowls for my bullpit puppy. They are very cute and light weight. I've had them for a couple weeks and they are rusting already where the bone is. Also they say that the bowls will hold 32 ozs they bearly hold 20 ozs. I dont see these lasting very long. Good for the price but not for bigger dogs .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for! Something he can't really destroy, easy to clean and the bone on the front of course is great !... Love it!
customer_reviews.author: bonnie p varnell

customer_reviews.title: Doubtful I’d Reorder
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I understand why it says “bowls” as though more than one is supposed to come. I thought this was a set. I was also surprised when I opened the box to find an iPhone charger - like what does this have to do with a dog bowl???
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M Neidhart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It gets scratched up. But not so bad im not sure if my dog did it im rarely home My dog was a month when he recieved it he was scared looking at his reflection on the outside then realizing it was on the inside too. He then ate stretched out it was funny and cute. It was huge for him doesn't move. But i guess the bowl is alright i was really pleased
customer_reviews.author: Brianaliz Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are absolutely wonderful and you can’t beat the price! Very impressed by the quality and looks! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these because my 11-week old puppy started to smell like metal randomly. After wiping the bowls multiple times, BLACK STUFF was coming off of it. Bought him new bowls and now he’s back to normal. Definitely don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are great for large dogs. They have a rubber guard around the bottom to keep the bowls from moving or flipping over. They are also super easy to clean. I would buy it again if I had to but I think they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Monnie

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The bowls are light, and to my surprise one of them has rust showing already. I don’t even think I had them for a full 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Dumitrescu Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Not bowled over but so far so good .
customer_reviews.text: 4 not 5 because the bowls are very light, which makes me wonder about durability. Also wonder how they’d do with dogs that love to tip over their bowls. Otherwise they are very nice and my 2 Malinois say they’re well-made, which they are. The plus of “very light” is they’ll be good for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Klappert

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 lab mixes----and these bowls are great. Love the rubber grip on the bottom, keeps them from chasing after their dish. The size is just right and they are so easy to clean. Both of my dogs weigh 80plus lbs, perfect size
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Cromer

customer_reviews.title: Daisy is now a queen.
customer_reviews.text: My wife’s lovely dog has not been eating from her bowl in almost a year. We tried everything changing food, changing her diet, nope nothing but treats. Reducing her unkibble food and trying to only have her kibble available she would eat but never her normal. I thought maybe she hates her bowls? Bought these bad boys and she is in heaven she guards them now from our cat. Great quality and bigger than they look.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bullard II

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not For German Shepherds But Otherwise Fine
customer_reviews.text: Despite the wide base of these bowls, my German Shepherd puppy is crafty enough to not only flip the bowls over but to also pick them up in his mouth and spread the mess elsewhere. These bowls might better for a smaller breed or more calm beast. This does not make them a bad product but buyers should be aware of this info.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Great looking bowls
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are well constructed and look great. Unfortunately, they were much larger than I expected and way too large for my 11 lb puppy that isn't getting much bigger. When they said good for puppies, they didn't mean small dogs. Rather than return them, I will give them to someone with a larger dog or donate them to a shelter.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Case

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to clean. Lightweight yet doesn't get pushed around across the floor like other bowls, on carpet or hardwoods.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are easy to clean, resist scratching and hold enough food for a large dog. The rubber base serves a double purpose; (1) Keeps the bowl in place on any surface. (2) Reduces the chance of static discharge which is common with other metal bowls ( but it's probably best to keep both bowls on a rubber mat to be safe.)
customer_reviews.author: DJ Woody Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Missing letters on my dog bowl. Not happy !!
customer_reviews.text: The bowls are nice. I ordered 2. And the 1 bowl the letters coming off or part of the letters are missing. I thought they would be on a lot better. Its a dog bowl it should be more durable. And these bowls were not cheap. And the lettering is like they went to Walmart and stuck letter on a bowl u can also get at Walmart. I am really upset about her name already missing letters.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really cute dog  bowls.
customer_reviews.text: They are really cute, easy to clean, and the rubber in the bottom keeps them from sliding around. I wish their space was used better. They hold less water than I was thinking they would. But they’re great for food.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Good for grown dogs, not so much puppies!
customer_reviews.text: Gr is at for mature dogs, not puppies. Our lab puppy keeps empying the wster out on the floor and carrying the bowl around in her mouth, then it turns into a chew toy for her. Very cute but does not do the job. Maybe the bottom should be heavier!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Light and small
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but our dog is 60 pound viszla and l need to fill often they look nice but wish they were deeper
customer_reviews.author: C.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Can’t really use it as a food ...
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. Can’t really use it as a food bowl anymore as she just swallows everything. I had to get her a slow eater one. We just use them as her water bowls now. Oh, and the rubber pieces that are supposed to make the bowls non slip we’re chewed off th first day lol, smh
customer_reviews.author: Destinē

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, holds up against my terrors, would be five stars if it was actually no slip.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size, very durable, easy-to-clean, and adorable. These are listed as anti-slip but that is a complete lie. A breeze could throw this thing.
customer_reviews.author: MsgrimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great quality metal, rubber finicky
customer_reviews.text: I was actually really surprised by the quality of the bowls and the little bones riveted/welded onto them (I am not sure what the joint is called). I was expecting cheap quality metal and plastic bones but these are really high quality. I'll be using these for years. Very easy to clean. The only downside is that the rubber on the bottom comes off all the time.
customer_reviews.author: morrowind119

customer_reviews.title: They are great for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are great for the price. We've been using them for about 2 months now. My pup eats and drinks and doesn't knock them over. The rubber at the bottom comes off so you can remove it and dry it. The rubber keeps them from sliding all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Bmoregurl23

customer_reviews.title: Want a REAL nice bowl for your dog?
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this item, my dog bowls were either too small, too hard to work with and slipped all over my floor. Not anymore!! These are the BEST bowls around!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: The dog bowl are nice, only one thing they little to big for are medium size dog are pug and a poodle that are medium size, but they are easy to clean and don't tip over that nice..
customer_reviews.author: Judith Timm

customer_reviews.title: Rubber comes off easily
customer_reviews.text: My puppy likes to flip and chew this bowl when its empty and his favorite part is the rubber "gripper" on the bottom that he takes off too easily. I had to remove the rubber from both of the bowls. As long as you have a dog that will leave the empty bowl alone, this bowl worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Frank

customer_reviews.title: Very cute bowls, but much larger than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cute bowls, but much larger than I expected. I gave them to my daughter for her much larger dog and ordered a different brand only because couldn't find this item in a 12 or 16-ounce capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M Hermes

customer_reviews.title: Look great and Priced perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and the price was great! I don’t know how any pet stores are still open cuz they totally overcharge!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great light-weight bowl for a dog that is hard for them to tip over.
customer_reviews.text: These bowls were the perfect size for my dog. They are lightweight construction but because of the shape and rubber matting my dog is unable to tip them over. The price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: jafo8868

customer_reviews.title: I was really pleased when I received these bowls as they are really ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really pleased when I received these bowls as they are really cute and don't slip around when my dog is eating. However after a week of use, the bone on the one that we use for water has completely rusted! Water splashing around is to be expected when a dog drinks water and I am disappointed that the bowl rusted so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Pattaphongse

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for price
customer_reviews.text: Product appeared fine at first but now it seems the black bottomed rubbering is separating from the bowl & will probably get moldy but other than that, good for the price
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

product_meta.title: GPET Dog Bowl 32 Oz Stainless Steel Bowls with Anti-Skid Rubber Base for Food or Water Perfect Dish for Dog Puppy Cat and Kitten
product_meta.description: Size:2 PackStainless steel dog bowls with rubber bottoms that wont slip . The best dog bowls on the market . This bowl didn't slide all over the place when your dog is eating. Features : Premium dog bowls at best price on, made with highest quality materials available, with rubber bottoms that wont slip, beautiful design in stainless steel. Benefits : 2 dog bowls for the price of one, wont slip to prevent scratches and damage to hardwood floor, very easy to clean (dishwasher safe), holds up to 32-ounce.
feature_bullets: ✅ SET OF 2 BOWLS - Value Pack for dogs - puppies - cats and kittens. The bowls hold up to 32 ounces of water , wet food , treats or anything you want to feed your pet with
✅ CONVENIENT and PRACTICAL Design: non-slip rubber base to avoid spills. Rust resistant material safe for your four-paw companions.
✅ STAINLESS STEEL- Our high quality feeders are great for dogs puppies cats and kittens. The bowls hold up to 32 ounces of water , wet food , treats or anything you want to feed your pet with
✅ DURABLE AND SAFE - Flawless design, dishwasher safe, and odor free, smooth and easy to clean. Non-toxic anti-skid rubber base prevents spills and mess
✅ SATISFACTION GUARANTEED - Covered by a 2-year warranty. 100% Money Back Guarantee No hassles, no questions asked
